context_bundle.summary: Port is an Internal Developer Platform that enables developers to self-serve infrastructure through a standardized developer portal

onboarding.quick_start: docker run --name port -p 8080:8080 -e PORT_CLIENT_ID=<client-id> -e PORT_CLIENT_SECRET=<client-secret> portai/port:latest
common_patterns: Installation: 'helm install port port/port --namespace port --create-namespace' for Kubernetes deployment
Blueprint creation: 'port create blueprint --name my-blueprint --file blueprint.json' with entity schema
Scorecard setup: Configure rules in port.yml and attach to blueprints for quality gates
Self-service actions: Action entity with trigger: 'create' and integration configuration
API integration: 'POST https://api.getport.io/v1/blueprints' with authentication headers
CI/CD pipeline: 'port run-action --action-name deploy --entity-identifier service-123' for automated deployments
known_errors: Authentication failed: 'curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' https://api.getport.io/v1/auth' and verify client credentials
Blueprint validation error: Check entity schema properties and required fields in blueprint definition
Action execution timeout: 'port get-action-run --run-id 12345' and check integration configuration
Scorecard not working: Verify blueprint has scorecard property and rules are properly configured
Entity sync failed: 'port logs --integration-id 12345' and check webhook or API authentication
